title: Delegate Jobs for Shiny Web Applications
text: Intra-session reactivity Shiny. shiny.worker allows delegate heavy computation tasks separate process, freeze Shiny app.

title: Delegate Jobs for Shiny Web Applications
text: Pick stable version CRAN: latest GitHub:

title: Delegate Jobs for Shiny Web Applications
text: See live example examples code examples/ folder.

title: Delegate Jobs for Shiny Web Applications
text: Initialise worker beggining app. , server Shiny app define promise returns reactive heavy job completed.
code: worker <- initialize_worker() my_heavy_calculations <- function(args) {   # ...   args }  # this reactive object is used to trigger the job start, # but also to pass parameters to the function reactive_arguments <- reactive({   input$start   list(r = rnorm(1)) })  # resultPromise will be a reactive value with results returned by my_heavy_calculations resultPromise <- worker$run_job("job1", my_heavy_calculations, args_reactive = reactive_arguments)  resultPromise()$result # contains the result of the calculations resultPromise()$resolved # contains flag that informs whether the job has finished or not

title: Shiny Worker R6 Class — Worker
code: Worker$run_job(   id,   fun,   args_reactive,   value_until_resolved = NULL,   invalidate_time = 1000 )

title: Shiny Worker R6 Class — Worker
text: id character job id fun function calculate args_reactive reactive arguments trigger job value_until_resolved default value returned job completed invalidate_time wait time invalidating reactive context (msec)
